articles.title: Korea's Cause of Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Korea's Cause of Reunification Supported 
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Gyanendra Bir Bikram Shah Dev, king of Nepal, when receiving the DPRK ambassador to the country who paid a farewell call on him on August 3, said he hoped that the north and the south of Korea would be reunified independently and peacefully by the efforts of the Korean people themselves, free from outside interference.
 Noting with pleasure that the friendly relations between the two countries had been developing on better terms in recent years, he expressed thanks to the government and people of the DPRK for supporting the Nepalese people, sincerely wishing Nepal sovereignty and national unity, peace and stability.    
 Meanwhile, Madav Kumar Nepal, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), when receiving the DPRK ambassador who paid a farewell call on him on August 2, said all the world progressive forces today were looking up to the DPRK and hoping that the Korean people would invariably defend socialism.

Greetings to Singaporean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Singaporean President 
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to S. R. Nathan, president of Singapore, on its national day.
 Kim in the message wished the president greater success in his work for the prosperity and development of the country.
